result.execSummary:
The defendant Obed L Garcia Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No violent contact with:  C.S.  
  Domestic Violence Counseling.
  AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. 
  Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. 
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
The Court denies the request for expungement.

timeConds.notes: Sentence credit of 2 days was granted.  TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Obed L Garcia Rivera

Defendant Obed L Garcia Rivera in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Attorney Reyes requests the Court schedule the case for plea and sentencing.  Interpreter available to appear at the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Obed L Garcia Rivera in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Attorney Reyes advises the Court he represents the Defendant on 16CM88 but he has not been assigned on the other new cases. Attorney Reyes advises the Court he represents the Defendant on 16CM88 but he has not been assigned on the other new cases.  Attorney Reyes requests a brief adjournment to allow time for appointment of counsel.   Interpreter available to apepar at next hearing. Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

The Defendant has retained Attorney Reyes on on this case but he not showing as attorney of record on his other cases. Attorney Michael Reyes in court.   Defendant Obed L Garcia Rivera did not appear.    Tim Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization. Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  The Defendant has completed upfront treatment but needs to finish paying for the treatment.  The Court schedules the case for plea and sentencing in 90 days.  The Defendant and interpreter's appearance is waived from the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Obed L Garcia Rivera in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Rick Kissell appears in person.  Attorney Rosario advises the the Court the parties have been in continued negotiations that involves upfront treatment.  The State would move to dismiss with the completion of treatment.  Attorney Rosaio requests an adjournment of the trial.  The State is in agreement with the adjournment request. The Court adjourns the trial and sets the case for a hearing in 30 days.  The Court to schedule an interpreter to appear at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Obed L Garcia Rivera in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Tim Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Attorney Suha requests an adjournment due to witness availability.  Attorney Rosario does not object to the adjournment request and advises the possibility the Defendant may wish to have new counsel appointed.  The Defendant advises the Court that he wishes to continue with Attorney Rosario as counsel.   The Court grants the adjournment and reschedules the trial.  Second interpreter to be scheduled for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:15 am.
